metadata.subtitle: Comprehensive foundational vocabulary for basic Japanese communication
metadata.readBothLabel: ğŸ”Š Read both Japanese and English

words.exampleMeaning: One hundred is smaller than one thousand.
I wake up at one o'clock.
I eat lunch at two o'clock.
I go home at five o'clock.
I watch TV at seven o'clock.
I go to bed at eleven o'clock.
There is a test on Thursday.
The second is a day off.
I will do my best this year too.

words.meaning: thank you for the meal (after eating)
words.exampleMeaning: Thank you for the meal. It was delicious.
I'm off. (lit. I'll go and come back)

words.meaning: have a good day, see you later (to someone leaving)

words.exampleMeaning: Nice to meet you. I'm Tanaka.

words.meaning: pleased to meet you, please treat me well

words.exampleMeaning: My father is a company employee.
Your mother is beautiful, isn't she?
How old is your older brother?
My older brother is a university student.
My older sister is a nurse.
Your grandmother is kind, isn't she?
My grandmother is good at cooking.

words.meaning: to wake up, to get up
words.exampleMeaning: I wake up at six o'clock.

words.meaning: to be, to exist (for animate objects)
to listen, to hear, to ask
to rest, to take a day off
to exist, to be (for inanimate objects)
words.exampleMeaning: There is a book on the desk.
It's a cute dog, isn't it?
I want to eat ice cream.
I send a letter at the post office.
I shop at the department store.
I buy books at the bookstore.
I watch a movie at the movie theater.
There is a book on the desk.
I go to school by bus.
What kind of food do you like?
That over there is a school.
Who is that person over there?
That place over there is the station.
I buy books, notebooks, and such.
I don't like it very much.

words.meaning: is not, am not, are not (polite negative)
was not, were not (polite past negative)
